message.body: i'm sorry to say, that I think you guys are going to suck too
I think we will be better than last year
that's better than last year, right?
I think we have the second easiest schedule in the league
being in the worst division in professional sports helps
i think that statement would be a little strong
but it is not the best division for sure
I think 7 is very attainable with just splitting san fran and arizona
and then oaklan, kc and den should be winnable games
i laugh just because i enjoy giving you a hard time
you definitely have an easy schedule
our hardest games are home against Giants
I am not sure how the division talk is giving me a hard time?
I have no allegiance to my division
it is something different when your team is like undefeated or something and you are trying to discount their greatness
but I am in the hunt for a superficial record
if we get 8 or 9 wins, we will easily be the worst team with that record
not trying to be funny, just stating facts
but i love how whenever anyone says something bad about the NFC West, you jump to its defense
my biggest question about the Hawks is who makes plays for you that scores points
there's no one on your offense that I'm worried about
if I have a solid defense
how did I jump to the defense?
your offensive line is a huge question mark, none of your RBs are gamebreakers, and you have solid WRs on paper...but none you have to double-team
I just said it probably isn't the worst division is proffessional sports
I think it is a shitty division
first good point you have made all morning
and yes we lack true playmakers and that is why we aren't very good
our running game is gong to be terrible
our pass protection will be fine
hasselbeck can be a good QB if protected
and I think our WR core will be above average
every week will be a grind
I think we are closer to being a 4 win team than a 9 win team
yeah, i think you are really going to struggle to score points
and I worry about your ability to rush the passer
you have some solid guys on the line...but no Patrick Kerney in his prime
I really don't think our offense will be that bad
I much less worried about that as I am our pass rush
yeah, i think you'll be able to score against bad defenses like the Rams and Cards...but against solid teams...it's going to be really difficult
luckily we play a lot of bad teams
that's why I think you should've taken CJ Spiller too
first off he wasn't an option
and no way I would take CJ over Okung
RBs are a dime a dozen
would he make our offense more exciting and threatening sure
i mean instead of Earl...but he wasn't there
I think i would take earl over him even if he was available
unless he's BDawk, safeties are a dime a dozen too
I think you can replace a RB most other positions
he definitely has the chance to be really special
RB lifespan is at best 7 or 8 years
i'd say same with a safety
seriosly? you think safety and RB have same shelf live?
i mean BDawk is probably a HOFer
decent RBs are usually around 5-7 years
i mean i'd say that for all positions
the good players are usually good for 507 years
I would say RBs have the shortest lifespan of all skill positions
but that's only true because there are a bunch of guys who suck that wash out after like 3 years
shit even Ryan Grant is going to have a 5-year career
i am not sure what that proves
he was the starting RB on a team that made the NFC champ
on a team that doesnt run the ball
where did the seahawks come into play?
essential is that the RB thing is WAY overrated
unless you are talking about scrubs
i'm not arguing the LT pick
you got how many great years from those guys
but other positions can play longer
Alexander had one of the greatest years ever
that is what we are talking about
we are purely talking shelf life
both will perform amazing well but at different aspects
but one car will breakdown and not perform as well after 8 years
the other car slowly declines rather than a massive decline
of course that is assuming all other things are equal
which you will NEVER know going into a draft
i get what you are saying, i really do
you had to take Okung there
but I'm saying the biggest hole on your offense is lack of talent at the skill positions
and that's where I'd take CJ Spiller over Earl
BDawk is a probably HOFer (maybe) and my favorite all-time Eagle
but in the 5 years of solid to amazing production that Westbrook gave the Eagles, he was more valuable
but you know where adrian peterson and chris johnson and MJD were drafted?
1st round pick is worth like 5 3rd rounders
i'm talking about actual talent on your team
okay, but my thinking is this
seahawks with cj spiller this year not challenganing for the superbowl
I think over the course of the next 2-3 years it is easier to find a RB who can be very, very productive
our secondary is atrocious last year
that's the best point you've made
here's my thing though to that
pete carroll needs to win games
not worry about who has the longer career
I think that we can find something over the course of the next couple years at RB at a lower cost that will produce a decent % of what spiller does
so all teams should mortgage the future for this year?
what positino usually wins offensive rookie of the year?
i don't think you mortgage your future by taking an elite back
over the past 20 years 12 have been RB
that means every year new RBS are making big impacts
easiest positino to get an impact out of initially
on a side note that is interesting
I just think you see much less turnover of good-great safeties then you do RBs
RBs come and go pretty quick
it would seem taht it is harder in future drafts to bring in a Safety that is a big impact guy than it is a RB
and i am not even talking about names
I take names off of it
14 RBs have won the rookie of the year
only one washed out after that
okay, but it seems just about every eyar you can take a RB int he first round
only one was a late round
where as a safetie may only come around every 5 years
i'm just saying...that the first rounder RB is such a risk
but look at the great safeties
I think RB is an easy positino
reed and polamalu have had major injuries
so my argument is just that...unless this person is an all-time elite player
you can count on about 5-7 years
there is no question on that
you wouldn't take Lewis's superbowl ring?
but you were just saying that RBs don
i say they aren't any shorter than the average NFL career
if you take out the scrubs
I think that is INSANE to think RBS dont have shorter lifes
who bring the median number down
none of those I just lilsted are scrubs
yet they all hit BIG walls at 30
we are arguing right next to each other
but you get 5-7 years of top-level production
you have persisted that RB do not have a shoerter shelf life
which is about the same of other NFL players
as far as their peak productive years
I think you get longer with other positions
you know safety and RB will both be top 5 at tehir postion for the next 6 years
safety will slowly decline and rb will hit wall after 30
but both will be very comparable as far as impact they have to their team during the first 5-7 years
well that safety is going to have to be amazing or the RB is going to have to be average if he has the same impact
i woudl take safety because I think it is harder to find an impact S than an impact RB
since Ed Reed has been there they have had good RBs
but there have been multiple good ones
but Ed Reed is a HOFer probably, right?
that's a tough comparison when talking about Earl Thomas and CJ Spiller
I am assuming one is a HOF and other isnt
okay, but I think it is easier to get a higher replacement value at RB than at safetey
i basically agree with much of your argument
but i think the RB thing is overrated
about the length of their career
do they decline when they hit 30?
i mean the list goes on and aone
but not to the degree of RBs
RBs drop off the face of the planet
yeah...but he was still the critical player on our squad for 4 years
that has nothing to do with lifespand
there is no other positino like it
20-30 times a game at least 7 guys are trying hit you as hard as they can
and jsut about every time someone succeeds
PS...i'm really worried about the Eagles OL
although hawks Run blocking is prob worse
i'm more worried about his our center and RG
SNY is carrying all Cuse BE games
another oil rig in the gulf blew up
what you guys giving the married couple?
it should be an interesting game
we should avoid the score and then use it as our test for ESPN3
wont be hard to avoid haha
it was set by the sports writers at the Daily News and the Inky
oh well that doesn't mean much
but i do wish i was getting +4
i think it will be good
you do realize that means that villinova is favored
the team previews sound pretty good
Temple has a good running game
Nova likes to run from the spread
I am so glad i am not rooting for Nova
you can just pay me $10 and root for Temple if you want
otherwise you are a Nova Lover
I heard you set up a fund for your first born to go to Nova
hahaha...i don't even know what a 529V is...so that doesn't hold water
so I changed to V for Villinova
i hope you have CP3 instead though
I would be rich as shit
and probably be working in sports
you pick up your tux yet?
and then I could ride your coattails off of his coattails
i'm all about quiting my job
got an email monday about it being ready
I was going to see if they could shorten my pants a little
you know so will doesn't feel out of place
looks good, didn't even see the vest though
i really hope Nassib doesn't wear a glove
you get the dtv app for your phone yet?
switched to verizon from the iphone
you should go for one of the android based phones
i'm going to check it out
erin got a bomb ass package from Radio Shack
why did she get a package from radio shack?
